Define Documentation

#define NATIVE_LANG_NAME   "NativeLang.dll"

Author:
Jens Lorenz <jens.plugin.npp@gmx.de>
Version:
1.0
Date:
2007
This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA.

Note:
This is the interface to NativeLang.dll plugin.
You need only to include this file into your project and
call the particular function to change language of dialogs
combo boxes, Notepad++ menu, menues, list headers.
Or get only the new text. Only one language can be supported
at once. The translations are stored in NativeLang.ini
in the plugins config folder. NativeLang.ini needs is
formated in USC2-little endian.

#define NLGetText   NLGetTextA

Use NLGetText to get the correct function and text format.

If precompiler flag _UNICODE is set NLGetTextW is used.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum eNatLangMsg

Enumerator:
NPP_NATLANG_CHANGEDLG  enum change complete dialog info
NPP_NATLANG_CHANGENPPMENU  enum change plugins menu of Notepad++
NPP_NATLANG_CHANGEMENU  enum change another menu
NPP_NATLANG_CHANGEHEADER  enum change header elements
NPP_NATLANG_CHANGECOMBO  enum change combo elements
NPP_NATLANG_GETTEXTA  enum get text via key name
NPP_NATLANG_GETTEXTW  enum get text via key name (wide char)

Function Documentation

void NLChangeCombo ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
HWND  hCombo,
LPCSTR  pszSection,
UINT  count 
) [static]

Change automaticaly the combo text. Call function in e.g. WM_INITDIALOG.

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] hCombo The handle of combo box.
[in] pszSection The section name in NativeLang.ini file.
[in] count The count of combo elements.
Return values:
void Nothing
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' 'section name']
pos_in_combo="new name"
...

void NLChangeDialog ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
HWND  hWnd,
LPCSTR  pszSection 
) [static]

Changes the dialog language. Call function in e.g. WM_INITDIALOG.

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] hWnd The window handle of the dialog box.
[in] pszSection The section name in NativeLang.ini file.
Return values:
void Nothing
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' 'section_name']
'resource_value'="new name"
...

Note:
'&' sign for key selection supported, e.g. "&Cancel process"

void NLChangeHeader ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
HWND  hHeader,
LPCSTR  pszSection 
) [static]

Change automaticaly the header text. Call function in e.g. WM_INITDIALOG.

[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] hHeader The handle of header.
[in] pszSection The section name in NativeLang.ini file.
Return values:
void Nothing
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' 'section name']
orig_name="new name"
...

BOOL NLChangeMenu ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
HMENU  hMenu,
LPCSTR  pszMenu,
UINT  mf_ByComPos 
) [static]

Changes given plugin menu. Call function before TrackPopupMenu().

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] hMenu The menu handle of the plugin menu.
[in] pszMenu The section name in NativeLang.ini file.
[in] mf_ByComPos Use here MF_BYCOMMAND or MF_BYPOSITION.
Return values:
BOOL FALSE if mf_ByComPos is not correct set.
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' 'section name']
menu_id_or_pos="new name"
...

Note:
'&' sign for key selection supported, e.g. "&Open.."

void NLChangeNppMenu ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
LPCSTR  pszPluginName,
FuncItem *  funcItem,
UINT  nbFunc 
) [static]

Changes Notepad++ plugins menu. Call function on notification NPPN_TBMODIFICATION.

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] pszPluginName The name of plugin that was given to Notepad++ on by function getName().
[in] funcItem The funcItem struct that was given to Notepad++ by function getFuncsArray().
[in] nbFunc The size of the funcItem struct that was given to Notepad++ by function getFuncsArray().
Return values:
void Nothing
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' NppMenu]
Main="new plugin name in Menu->Plugins"
0="name of entry 0"
...

Note:
'&' sign for key selection supported, e.g. "&Explorer..."

UINT NLGetTextA ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
LPCSTR  pszKey,
LPSTR  pszText,
UINT  length 
) [static]

ANSI version to get a language specific text by a key.

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] pszKey The key name in NativeLang.ini file.
[out] pszText The buffer to fill.
[in] length The maximum length of text buffer.
Return values:
UINT The size of the copied chars into pszText.
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' Text]
key_name="text"
...

Note:
Format tags are supported. Use % instead of \, e.g. t s d n

UINT NLGetTextW ( HINSTANCE  hInst,
HWND  hNpp,
LPCSTR  pszKey,
LPWSTR  pszText,
UINT  length 
) [static]

UNICODE version to get a language specific text by a key.

Parameters:
[in] hInst The instance handle of dialog.
[in] hNpp The window handle of Notepad++.
[in] pszKey The key name in NativeLang.ini file.
[out] pszText The buffer to fill.
[in] length The maximum length of text buffer.
Return values:
UINT The size of the copied chars into pszText.
Add in NativeLang.ini a section like the following:

['plugin_file_name' Text]
key_name="text"
...

Note:
Format tags are supported. Use % instead of \, e.g. t s d n
